greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by antidiagonals: n-th row of table consists of the positive integers divisible by exactly n distinct primes.
comment: Concatenated sequence is a permutation of the integers >= 2.
mathematica: f[n_, m_] := f[n, m] = Block[{c = m, k = If[m == 1, Product[Prime[i], {i, n}], f[n, m - 1] + 1]},While[Length@FactorInteger[k] != n, k++ ];k];Table[f[d - m + 1, m], {d, 10}, {m, d}] // Flatten (* _Ray Chandler_, Feb 08 2007 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jan 29 2007
